body:
If you define a static attribute, Vue will not attempt to dynamically merge it.

If you provide a binding, Vue will do that:

https://jsfiddle.net/t0kb6vyu/3/

Ok, nice to know. But Vue 1 did merge regardless of static or dynamic attribute. It would be nice if this behavior can be continued with Vue 2 as this is quite important when writing libraries/frameworks with Vue 2. I can elaborate if needed. Just my thoughts. Thanks for the answer!
Yeah we will look into that, sure!
Like class module, I think **style** should also have the same behavior for consistency. I'll try to make a PR.
@defcc yeah, probably need to treat `staticStyle` and `style` separately, and need to parse static style strings into objects.
Almost done. I'll make a PR later.

issue.title: enable style merge behavior between parent-child components (fix #3997)

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body:
fix #3997

Style priority orders as bellow:
1. binding style > static style.
2. parent style > child style.

issue.title: Patched elements keep inline styles from old vnodes

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body: ### Vue.js version 2.0.6+ ### Reproduction Link https://jsfiddle.net/gw8g8cos/ ![vue-glitch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19538283/20378887/e073b9a6-ac4d-11e6-8254-c1fb079ff122.gif) ### Steps to reproduce ``` $ vue init webpack-simple . $ npm install vue@2.0.7 vue-template-compiler@2.0.7 ``` ```vue ``` ### What is Expected? Patched elements should not keep inline styles from old vnodes. ### What is actually happening? During the update operation, patched elements will retain styles from vnodes that will no longer exist in the DOM. Temporarily solution for end-users: changing inline styles to classes, choosing different tag names or adding a `key` directive will fix the issue. Thanks to @LinusBorg for the latter. It looks like this PR has introduced this regression https://github.com/vuejs/vue/pull/4138. I've opened a pull request with a failing test that confirms this issue.
